queries.details: Rates/Premiums/Contributions tables; capture tier, coverage level, pay frequency, and employee vs employer share.

entities.criteria: All premium rates/contributions shown (employee + dependent tiers, coverage level, plan option, pay frequency); include employee vs employer share if stated.
Describes who is eligible for coverage based on employment status and required work hours.

queries.details: Eligibility/Enrollment/Termination/Leave/Continuation sections; capture exact rule text, time windows, and effective/end dates.

entities.criteria: Return one concise sentence summarizing who is eligible for coverage based on employment status and required work hours. Exclude procedural steps, waiting period details, and legal language.
Extract rules for student dependents: maximum age, required student status (full-time/credit hours), verification, and when coverage ends.
Extract eligibility rules for domestic partners and/or common-law spouses: definition, required proof, enrollment timing, and termination triggers.
Describes when a spouse’s coverage ends due to loss of eligibility or qualifying events such as divorce or legal separation.
Explains when dependent coverage ends due to age limits, status changes, or loss of eligibility.
Extract the waiting period: length, when it starts (hire date/first of month), when coverage begins, and any exceptions.

queries.details: Deductible section/SBC; capture in/out-of-network, per person vs family, embedded vs aggregate, and calendar vs plan year accumulation/reset wording.

entities.criteria: The individual/person deductible for in-network/participating and out-of-network/non-network; capture amount, per-person wording, and any notes (e.g., “deductible does not apply”).
The family deductible for in-network/participating and out-of-network/non-network; capture amount, how it’s met (combined family vs per member), and any notes.
Identify whether the plan uses an embedded or aggregate family deductible (or both); extract the exact label/description and any related thresholds (e.g., individual embedded amount).

entities.entity: Calendar Year or Plan Year Deductible accumulation
entities.criteria: Identify whether the deductible accumulates/resets by calendar year or plan year (benefit year); include any reset date or coverage period start/end.

queries.details: Cost Sharing/Coinsurance section; capture in/out-of-network, %, “after deductible” notes, and any coinsurance maximum definitions.

entities.criteria: Identify the coinsurance rate (%) for in-network and out-of-network (or “Not covered”); include any triggers like “after deductible” and the exact phrasing.
Any per-person cap on coinsurance (e.g., “coinsurance maximum,” “max coinsurance amount”) for in-network and out-of-network; include the amount and definition.
Any family cap on coinsurance for in-network and out-of-network; include the amount and definition.

queries.details: Out-of-Pocket Maximum section/SBC; capture in/out-of-network, and whether copays/deductible/coinsurance count (exact wording).

entities.criteria: The individual/person out-of-pocket maximum/limit for in-network and out-of-network; include what expenses count toward it (e.g., deductible, coinsurance, copays) if stated.
The family out-of-pocket maximum/limit for in-network and out-of-network; include whether there is an embedded individual OOP and what counts toward it (if stated).

queries.details: Office Visit/Telehealth/Virtual Visit benefits; capture copay vs coinsurance, in/out-of-network, and visit-type qualifiers.

entities.entity: Primary Care Physician Office Visit Copayment
entities.criteria: The PCP office visit copay (and if copay differs by in/out-of-network); include visit type qualifiers (routine/sick).
The specialist visit copay (or coinsurance) and any referral requirement note; include in/out-of-network if shown.
The telehealth copay (or coinsurance) and whether it differs by in/out-of-network or provider type; include any “deductible applies” note.
The cost share for virtual visits/online visits/e-visits (copay/coinsurance) and any limits; include in/out-of-network if shown.

queries.details: Extract from Urgent Care/Emergency Room benefits; capture copay vs coinsurance, waiver if admitted (ER), and in/out-of-network wording.

entities.criteria: The urgent care copay (or coinsurance); include in/out-of-network if shown and any deductible note.
The ER copay (and any waiver if admitted); include in/out-of-network wording and deductible applicability.

queries.details: Lab/Diagnostics/Imaging sections; capture office vs outpatient hospital/facility differences and deductible applies notes.

entities.criteria: The cost share for lab services/diagnostic testing (office vs outpatient hospital if separated); include deductible applicability and in/out-of-network if shown.
The cost share for advanced imaging (MRI/CT/PET); capture whether it’s copay vs coinsurance, facility vs office, and in/out-of-network if shown.

queries.details: Inpatient/Outpatient/Facility Services benefits; capture per day/per stay copays, coinsurance, deductible applies, and in/out-of-network.

entities.criteria: The cost share for inpatient hospital admission (copay per stay/day and/or coinsurance); include deductible applicability and in/out-of-network if shown.
The cost share for outpatient hospital/ambulatory services (facility services); include copay/coinsurance, deductible applicability, and in/out-of-network if shown.

queries.details: Prescription Drug/Rx section; capture tiers, copay/coinsurance per tier, and any Rx deductible/limits.

entities.criteria: The prescription drug benefits: tiers (generic/preferred/non-preferred/specialty), copay/coinsurance per tier, and any Rx deductible or limits (mail order, specialty).

queries.details: Mental Health/Substance Use Disorder section; capture inpatient vs outpatient (if separated), cost share, and any authorization/limits.

entities.criteria: The coverage/cost share for mental health and substance use disorder services (inpatient/outpatient if separated); include copay/coinsurance, deductible applicability, and limits/authorization if stated.

properties.group_name: Mental Health and Substance Use Benefits

queries.details: Therapy/Rehab benefits; capture copay/coinsurance, visit/session limits, and prior authorization notes.

entities.criteria: The cost share for physical therapy; include visit limits and authorization notes.
The cost share for speech therapy; include visit limits and authorization notes.
The cost share for occupational therapy; include visit limits and authorization notes.
The coverage and cost share for cardiac rehabilitation; include session limits and authorization notes.
The coverage and cost share for pulmonary rehabilitation; include session limits and authorization notes.
The coverage and cost share for other rehab therapies (e.g., post-acute rehab categories used by the plan); include limits/authorization.

queries.details: Chiropractic/Acupuncture benefits; capture cost share and visit limits/authorization.

entities.criteria: The cost share for chiropractic services; include any visit limit and referral/authorization notes.
The cost share for acupuncture; include any limits/authorization.

queries.details: Home Health/Hospice/SNF/DME benefits; capture cost share, day/visit limits, and authorization.

entities.criteria: The cost share for DME (durable medical equipment); include deductible applicability, coinsurance/copay, and any limits/authorization.
The cost share for home health care/home nursing; include visit limits and authorization notes if stated.
The cost share for hospice care (inpatient/outpatient if separated); include limits/authorization if stated.
The cost share for skilled nursing facility (SNF); include per-day copay/coinsurance, day limits, and authorization notes.

properties.group_name: Home, Hospice, Skilled Nursing, and Equipment

queries.details: Maternity/Newborn/Pediatric sections; capture cost share, coverage limits, and any age restrictions.

entities.criteria: The coverage/cost share for maternity/prenatal/delivery (office visits, facility, professional fees if separated); include deductible applicability and limits.
The coverage/cost share for newborn care (routine nursery, complications/NICU if stated); include deductible applicability and limits.
Extract whether pediatric dental is covered and the cost share/limits; include age limits if stated.
Extract whether pediatric vision is covered and the cost share/limits (exam, materials if listed); include age limits if stated.

queries.details: Condition-specific sections; capture coverage vs exclusion, cost share, and limits/authorization.

entities.criteria: The coverage and cost share for infertility evaluation/treatment; capture any exclusions (e.g., IVF not covered) and limits.
The coverage/cost share for autism services (ABA/behavioral therapy if mentioned); include limits/authorization or exclusions.
The cost share for allergy testing and allergy immunotherapy/shots (if separated); include limits/authorization if stated.

queries.details: Ambulance/Transport benefits; capture ground vs air cost share and in/out-of-network wording.

entities.criteria: The cost share for ground ambulance; include deductible applicability and in/out-of-network if shown.
The cost share for air ambulance; include deductible applicability and in/out-of-network if shown.

queries.details: The plan’s stated coverage period basis (plan year/calendar year/benefit year) and any effective start/end dates.

entities.criteria: The plan’s stated coverage period label (plan year/calendar year/benefit year) and any effective dates (start/end) shown in the document.

properties.group_name: Plan Year vs Calendar Year Basis

queries.details: Exclusions/Limitations/Not Covered sections; list explicit exclusions, caps, and restrictive clauses using exact wording.

entities.criteria: The Exclusions & Limitations section: list the explicit exclusions/limits (services not covered, visit/day caps, special restrictions) using the document’s exact wording
Return one concise sentence summarizing when and under what circumstances the plan or contract may be terminated. Exclude notice periods, administrative requirements, and legal clauses.
Return one concise sentence summarizing when employee coverage ends due to termination of employment or loss of eligibility. Exclude COBRA, notice, or administrative details.
Return one concise sentence summarizing when a spouse’s coverage ends due to loss of eligibility or qualifying events such as divorce or legal separation. Exclude notice and enrollment procedures.
Return one concise sentence summarizing when dependent coverage ends due to age limits or loss of eligibility. Exclude continuation or administrative details.
Extract coverage rules for rehire/recall/layoff: waiting period restart vs waive, eligibility continuity window, and effective date upon return.
Extract coverage rules during medical leave/LOA/FMLA: whether coverage continues, required premium payment, maximum duration, and reinstatement upon return.

queries.details: Extract only the document language required to determine employee eligibility and enrollment start rules, eligible spouse/dependent definitions, and any explicit rehire/reinstatement eligibility rule. Prioritize coverage eligibility thresholds (e.g., full-time/regular class, minimum hours/week), coverage effective date triggers (date of hire, 30 days then 1st of month, 90th day, etc.), and any active-at-work requirement only if it directly conditions eligibility or coverage start. Also capture eligible spouse language (legal spouse/domestic partner/common law) and dependent child age limit language (e.g., to age 26). Include rehire/reinstatement/break-in-service rules only when explicitly stated. Exclude content that is not needed to determine eligibility structure, such as open enrollment/QLE change rules, “making changes during the year,” COBRA/HRA claims/reimbursement instructions, employer contribution/minimum participation/GI amounts, and coverage end/termination timing.

entities.criteria: Extract the exact question text or section heading that corresponds to employee eligibility threshold, coverage effective date trigger, eligible spouse definition, dependent child age limit, or rehire/reinstatement rule; if the document is not in Q&A format, use the relevant heading verbatim (e.g., “Eligibility,” “Covered Members,” “Who’s Eligible,” “Eligible Dependents,” “Coverage Begins,” “Effective Date,” “Rehire,” “Reinstatement”).

Extract the verbatim text directly answering the eligibility item, limited to employee hours/class, coverage start trigger (DOH / 30 days then 1st of month / 90th day), spouse eligibility type, child age limit, and rehire/reinstatement rule if present; include active-at-work only when explicitly tied to eligibility/coverage start. Do not include QLE/open enrollment change language, reimbursement/claims language, contribution/participation/GI fields, or coverage end/termination language.

queries.details: Extract only the document’s explicit termination timing rules for when coverage ends, including the trigger (employment termination, loss of eligibility, etc.) and the timing (end of month, end of month following, day of termination/last day worked), and capture any benefit-line differences when explicitly stated (e.g., different timing for medical, dental, vision, Rx, etc.). If the document is not in Q&A format, use the most relevant termination timing heading (e.g., “Coverage Ends,” “When Coverage Ends,” “Termination of Coverage,” “When Coverage Terminates,” “Coverage Termination”) as the “Question,” and extract the verbatim termination timing text beneath it as the “Answer” until the next major section break. Exclude continuation-only content (e.g., COBRA rights/descriptions, agency contact info, Marketplace text) unless it explicitly states when coverage terminates, and exclude reimbursement/claims language (e.g., HRA rules).

entities.criteria: Extract the exact question text or section heading that asks/states when coverage ends or terminates (coverage ends/termination of coverage/when coverage ends), including benefit-specific termination headings if present.

Extract the verbatim termination timing language that answers when coverage ends, including trigger and timing (EOM, EOM following, day of termination/last day of employment) and any explicitly stated benefit-line split; exclude continuation-only language and administrative/claims text unless it contains explicit termination timing.

queries.details: Extract all exclusions, limitations, restrictions, and non-coverage language found anywhere in the document, including headings, benefit descriptions, tables, footnotes, and “important information” callouts. Capture both (a) any global exclusions/limitations section text and (b) any embedded micro-exclusions/limits within specific services. Treat any statement that uses exclusion/limit language as in-scope, such as “excluded,” “not covered,” “no coverage,” “does not include,” “not payable,” “limited to,” “maximum,” “cap,” “visit limit,” “frequency limit,” “prior authorization required,” “precertification,” “medical necessity required,” “experimental/investigational,” “cosmetic,” “out-of-network restriction,” or “outside the U.S./foreign travel.” Also capture explicit language related to the five priority medical exclusions: Mental Health/Substance Use Disorder, gene therapy/orphan drugs, foreign travel/out-of-country coverage, injury during crime/felony/illegal acts, and weight loss/weight loss drugs. Extract verbatim only; do not infer or summarize.

entities.criteria: Extract the exact question text if the document is in Q&A format; otherwise extract the closest applicable heading or label verbatim that introduces the exclusion/limitation language. This may be a major section heading (e.g., “Exclusions,” “Limitations,” “What’s Not Covered,” “Non-Covered Services”) or a local label within a benefit table/callout (e.g., “Limitations, Exceptions, & Other Important Information,” “Not covered,” “Excludes,” “Coverage limitations,” “Plan limitations,” “Important”).

Extract the verbatim exclusion/limitation language associated with the question/heading/label, including any non-coverage statements, limits (visits/frequency/dollar caps), conditions (medical necessity, prior authorization/precertification), network restrictions, geographic restrictions (foreign travel/outside U.S.), and named excluded services/drugs. If the “Question” is a section heading or table label, extract the bullets/rows/footnotes/paragraphs directly under it up to the next major section break or label change, without summarizing. Include even short or intricate clauses and footnotes when they contain exclusion/limitation language, especially for the five priority exclusions.
